tag.name: abbr
tag.help: Indicates an abbreviated form, like "Inc.", "etc."

tag.name: acronym
tag.help: Defines an acronym

tag.name: address
tag.help: Defines the start of an address. You should use it to define addresses, signatures, or authorships of documents.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: The class of the element

tag.name: applet
tag.help: Defines an embedded applet. The applet element was deprecated in HTML 4.01; use object

parameter.name: alt
parameter.help: An alternate text to be displayed if the browser support applets but cannot run this applet

parameter.name: archive
parameter.help: A URL to the applet when it is stored in a Java Archive or ZIP file

parameter.name: code
parameter.help: A URL that points to the class of the applet

parameter.name: codebase
parameter.help: Indicates the base URL of the applet if the code attribute is relative

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the applet (to use in scripts)

parameter.name: object
parameter.help: Defines the name of the resource that contains a serialized representation of the applet

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: Additional information to be displayed in tool tip

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Defines the horizontal spacing around the applet

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Defines the vertical spacing around the applet

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Defines the height of the applet

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Defines the width of the applet

tag.name: area
tag.help: Defines a region in an image map.

parameter.name: alt
parameter.help: Specifies an alternate text for the area

parameter.name: coords
parameter.help: Specifies the coordinates for the clickable area

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: Specifies the target URL of the area

parameter.name: nohref
parameter.help: Excludes an area from the image map

parameter.name: shape
parameter.help: Defines the shape of the area

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Where to open the target URL.

tag.name: base
tag.help: Specifies a base URL for all the links in a page. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: Specifies the URL to use as the base URL for links in the page

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Where to open all the links on the page. This attribute can be overridden by using the target attribute in each link.

tag.name: basefont
tag.help: Defines a base font. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: color
parameter.help: Specifies the text color. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: face
parameter.help: Specifies the font to use. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Font size for font elements. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

tag.name: bdo
tag.help: Overrides the default text direction.

parameter.name: dir
parameter.help: Defines the text direction

tag.name: blockquote
tag.help: Defines the start of a long quotation.

parameter.name: cite
parameter.help: URL of the quote, if it is taken from the web

tag.name: body
tag.help: The body element defines the documents' body. All "presentation attributes" of the body element were deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: alink
parameter.help: Specifies the color of the active links in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: background
parameter.help: An image to use as the background. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: The background color of the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: link
parameter.help: Specifies the color of all the links in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: Specifies the color of the text in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: vlink
parameter.help: Specifies the color of the visited links in the document. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

tag.name: br
tag.help: Inserts a single line break. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed

tag.name: button
tag.help: Defines a push button form element.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables the button

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies a unique name for the button

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Defines the type of button

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Specifies an initial value for the button. The value can be changed by a script

tag.name: fieldset
tag.help: The fieldset element draws a box around its containing elements.

tag.name: font
tag.help: Specifies the font face, font size, and font color of text. The font element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: color
parameter.help: Defines the color of the text in the font element. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: face
parameter.help: Defines the font of the text in the font element. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Defines the size of the text in the font element. Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: form
tag.help: Creates a form for client input

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: A URL that defines where to send the data when the submit button is pushed

parameter.name: accept
parameter.help: A comma separated list of content types that the server that process this form will handle correctly

parameter.name: accept-charset
parameter.help: A comma separated list of possible character sets for the form data. The default value is "unknown"

parameter.name: enctype
parameter.help: The mime type used to encode the content of the form

parameter.name: method
parameter.help: The HTTP method for sending data to the action URL. Default is get.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the form

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Where to open the target URL.

tag.name: frame
tag.help: Defines a sub window (a frame). * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: frameborder
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not to display a frame border

parameter.name: longdesc
parameter.help: A URL to a long description of the frame contents

parameter.name: marginheight
parameter.help: Defines the top and bottom margins of the frame

parameter.name: marginwidth
parameter.help: Defines the left and right margins of the iframe

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies a unique name of the iframe (to use in scripts)

parameter.name: noresize
parameter.help: When set to noresize the user cannot resize the frame

parameter.name: scrolling
parameter.help: Define scroll bars

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: The URL of the document to show in the frame

tag.name: frameset
tag.help: The frameset element defines a frameset. It is used to organize multiple windows (frames)

parameter.name: cols
parameter.help: Defines the number and size of columns in a frameset

parameter.name: rows
parameter.help: Defines the number and size of rows in a frameset

tag.name: h1
tag.help: The "align" attribute was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: h2
tag.help: The "align" attribute was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: h3
tag.help: The "align" attribute was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: h4
tag.help: The "align" attribute was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: h5
tag.help: The "align" attribute was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: h6
tag.help: The "align" attribute was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: head
tag.help: The head element can contain information about the document.

parameter.name: profile
parameter.help: A space separated list of URL's that contains meta data information about the page

tag.name: hr
tag.help: Inserts a horizontal rule. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed. All "presentation attributes" were deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: noshade
parameter.help: When set to true the rule should render in a solid color, when set to false the rule should render in a two-color "groove". Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Specifies the thickness (height) of the horizontal rule. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Specifies the width of the horizontal rule Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: html
tag.help: This element tells a browser that this is an HTML document. The xmlns attribute is required in XHTML but not in HTML. (http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml)

parameter.name: xmlns
parameter.help: Defines the XML namespace attribute

tag.name: iframe
tag.help: Creates an inline frame that contains another document.

parameter.name: frameborder
parameter.help: Specifies whether or not to display a frame border

parameter.name: longdesc
parameter.help: A URL to a long description of the frame contents

parameter.name: marginheight
parameter.help: Defines the top and bottom margins of the iframe

parameter.name: marginwidth
parameter.help: Defines the left and right margins of the iframe

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies a unique name of the iframe (to use in scripts)

parameter.name: scrolling
parameter.help: Define scroll bars

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: The URL of the document to show in the iframe

tag.name: img
tag.help: The img element defines an image. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: alt
parameter.help: Defines a short description of the image

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: The URL of the image to display

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: Defines a border around an image. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: ismap
parameter.help: Defines the image as a server-side image map

parameter.name: longdesc
parameter.help: A URL to a document that contains a long description of the image

parameter.name: usemap
parameter.help: Defines the image as a client-side image map.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Defines white space on the left and right side of the image. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Defines white space on the top and bottom of the image. Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: input
tag.help: Defines the start of an input field where the client can enter data. * In HTML the input tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the input tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: accept
parameter.help: A comma-separated list of MIME types that indicates the MIME type of the file transfer.

parameter.name: alt
parameter.help: Defines an alternate text for the image.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the input element.

parameter.name: checked
parameter.help: Indicates that the input element should be checked when it first loads.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables the input element when it first loads so that the user can not write text in it, or select it.

parameter.name: readonly
parameter.help: Indicates that the value of this field cannot be modified.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Defines the maximum number of characters allowed in a text field.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Defines the size of the input element.

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: Defines the URL of the image to display.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The class of the element

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The default value of the element.

tag.name: ins
tag.help: Defines inserted text.

parameter.name: cite
parameter.help: Defines a URL to another document which explains why the text was deleted or inserted

parameter.name: datetime
parameter.help: Defines the date and time the text was deleted

tag.name: label
tag.help: Defines a label to a control

parameter.name: for
parameter.help: Defines which form element the label is for. Set to an ID of a form element.

tag.name: caption
tag.help: Defines a table caption

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: The class of the element

tag.name: center
tag.help: Centers its enclosed text horizontally. The center element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: col
tag.help: Defines the attribute values for one or more columns in a table.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: span
parameter.help: Defines the number of columns the col should span

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Defines the width of the column

tag.name: colgroup
tag.help: Defines groups of table columns. With this element, you can group columns for formatting. This element is only valid inside the table tag.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: span
parameter.help: Defines the number of columns the colgroup should span

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Defines the width of the column group. Note: The width attribute can be overridden by settings in col

tag.name: dd
tag.help: Defines the description of a term in a definition list.

tag.name: del
tag.help: Defines text that has been deleted in a document.

parameter.name: cite
parameter.help: Defines a URL to another document which explains why the text was deleted or inserted

parameter.name: datetime
parameter.help: Defines the date and time the text was deleted

tag.name: dir
tag.help: defines a directory list. The dir element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: compact
parameter.help: Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: div
tag.help: Defines a division/section in a document. The "align" attribute of the div element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: dl
tag.help: Defines a definition list.

tag.name: dt
tag.help: Defines the start of a term in a definition list.

tag.name: legend
tag.help: Defines a caption for a fieldset.

tag.name: li
tag.help: The tag defines the start of a list item. It is used in both ordered and unordered lists. The "type" and "value" attributes of the li element were deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the type of the list. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: link
tag.help: This element defines the relationship between two linked documents. * In HTML tag has no end tag. * In XHTML tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: Defines the character encoding of the target URL. Default value is "ISO-8859-1"

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: The target URL of the resource

parameter.name: hreflang
parameter.help: Defines the base language of the target URL

parameter.name: media
parameter.help: Specifies on what device the document will be displayed

parameter.name: rel
parameter.help: Defines the relationship between the current document and the targeted document

parameter.name: rev
parameter.help: Defines the relationship between the targeted document and the current document

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Where to open the target URL.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the MIME type of the target URL

tag.name: map
tag.help: Defines a client-side image-map. An image-map is an image with clickable regions.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the map tag (for backwards compability).

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the map tag

tag.name: menu
tag.help: Defines a menu list. The menu element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: compact
parameter.help: Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: meta
tag.help: The element provides meta-information about your page, such as descriptions and keywords for search engines and refresh rates.

parameter.name: content
parameter.help: Defines meta information to be associated with http-equiv or name

parameter.name: http-equiv
parameter.help: Connects the content attribute to an HTTP header

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Connects the content attribute to a name

parameter.name: scheme
parameter.help: Defines a format to be used to interpret the value of the content attribute

tag.name: noframes
tag.help: Displays text for browsers that do not handle frames. The noframes element goes inside the frameset element.

tag.name: noscript
tag.help: Used to define an alternate content (text) if a script is NOT executed.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: The class of the element

tag.name: object
tag.help: Defines an embedded object. Use this element to add multimedia to your XHTML page.

parameter.name: archive
parameter.help: A space separated list of URL's to archives. The archives contains resources relevant to the object

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: Defines a border around the object

parameter.name: classid
parameter.help: Defines a class ID value as set in the Windows Registry or a URL

parameter.name: codebase
parameter.help: Defines where to find the code for the object

parameter.name: codetype
parameter.help: The internet media type of the code referred to by the classid attribute

parameter.name: data
parameter.help: Defines a URL that refers to the object's data

parameter.name: declare
parameter.help: Defines that the object should only be declared, not created or instantiated until needed

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Defines the horizontal spacing around the object

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Defines the vertical spacing around the object

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the object (to use in scripts)

parameter.name: standby
parameter.help: Defines a text to display while the object is loading

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Defines the MIME type of data specified in the data attribute

parameter.name: usemap
parameter.help: Specifies a URL of a client-side image map to be used with the object

tag.name: ol
tag.help: Defines the start of an ordered list. The "compact", "start" and "type" attributes of the ol element were deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: compact
parameter.help: Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: Specifies the number to start on. Deprecated. Use styles instead

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the type of the list. Deprecated. Use styles instead

tag.name: optgroup
tag.help: Defines an option group. This element allows you to group choices. When you have a long list of options, groups of related choices are easier to handle.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Defines the label for the option group

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables the option-group when it first loads

tag.name: option
tag.help: Defines an option in the drop-down list. * In HTML the tag has no end tag. * In XHTML the tag must be properly closed.

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Specifies that the option should be disabled when it first loads

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Defines a label to use when using [optgroup]

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: Specifies that the option should appear selected (will be displayed first in the list)

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Defines the the value of the option to be sent to the server

tag.name: p
tag.help: Defines a paragraph. All "presentation attributes" of the p element were deprecated in HTML 4.01.

tag.name: param
tag.help: The param element allows you to specify the run-time settings for an object inserted into XHTML documents.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the parameter

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: The id for this element

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the internet media type for the parameter

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Specifies the value of the parameter

parameter.name: valuetype
parameter.help: Specifies the MIME type of the value

tag.name: pre
tag.help: The pre element defines preformatted text. The "width" attribute of the pre element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Defines the maximum number of characters per line (usually 40, 80, or 132)

tag.name: q
tag.help: Defines the start of a short quotation.

parameter.name: cite
parameter.help: Defines a citation for the quotation

tag.name: script
tag.help: Defines a script, such as a JavaScript. The "language" attribute of the script element was deprecated in HTML 4.01.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Indicates the MIME type of the script

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: Defines the character encoding used in script

parameter.name: defer
parameter.help: Indicates that the script is not going to generate any document content.

parameter.name: language
parameter.help: Specifies the scripting language. Deprecated. Use the type attribute instead.

parameter.name: src
parameter.help: Defines a URL to a file that contains the script

tag.name: select
tag.help: The select element creates a drop-down list.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Defines a unique name for the drop-down list

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Definer the number of visible items in the drop-down list

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: When set, it disables the drop-down list

parameter.name: multiple
parameter.help: When set, it specifies that multiple items can be selected at a time

tag.name: span
tag.help: Used to group inline-elements in a document.

tag.name: strike
tag.help: ** Deprecated in HTML 4.01. ** Defines strikethrough text

tag.name: s
tag.help: ** Deprecated in HTML 4.01. ** Defines strikethrough text

tag.name: cite
tag.help: Defines a citation

tag.name: var
tag.help: Defines a variable

tag.name: kbd
tag.help: Defines keyboard text

tag.name: samp
tag.help: Defines sample computer code

tag.name: code
tag.help: Defines computer code text

tag.name: dfn
tag.help: Defines a definition term

tag.name: strong
tag.help: Renders as strong emphasized text

tag.name: em
tag.help: Renders as emphasized text

tag.name: style
tag.help: Defines a style in a document.

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: A text to display in a tool tip

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Defines the content-type

parameter.name: media
parameter.help: The destination medium for the style information

tag.name: sub
tag.help: Defines subscript text.

tag.name: sup
tag.help: Defines superscript text.

tag.name: table
tag.help: Defines a table. Inside a table tag you can put table headers, table rows, table cells, and other tables.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: Specifies the border width.

parameter.name: cellpadding
parameter.help: Specifies the space between the cell walls and contents

parameter.name: cellspacing
parameter.help: Specifies the space between cells

parameter.name: summary
parameter.help: Specifies a summary of the table for speech-synthesizing/ non-visual browsers

parameter.name: frame
parameter.help: Specifies how the outer borders should be displayed. Note: Must be used in conjunction with the "border" attribute

parameter.name: rules
parameter.help: Specifies the horizontal/vertical divider lines. Note: Must be used in conjunction with the "border" attribute

tag.name: tbody
tag.help: Defines a table body.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

tag.name: td
tag.help: Defines a cell in a table.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Specifies if this cell provides header information for the rest of the row that contains it

parameter.name: rowspan
parameter.help: Indicates the number of rows this cell should span

parameter.name: nowrap
parameter.help: Whether to disable or enable automatic text wrapping in this cell. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.help: A space-separated list of cell IDs that supply header information for the cell. This attribute allows text-only browsers to render the header information for a given cell

parameter.name: colspan
parameter.help: Indicates the number of columns this cell should span

parameter.name: abbr
parameter.help: Specifies an abbreviated version of the content in a cell

parameter.name: axis
parameter.help: Defines a name for a cell

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

tag.name: textarea
tag.help: Defines a text-area (a multi-line text input control).

parameter.name: rows
parameter.help: Specifies the number of columns visible in the text-area

parameter.name: cols
parameter.help: Specifies the number of rows visible in the text-area

parameter.name: disabled
parameter.help: Disables the text-area when it is first displayed

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Specifies a name for the text-area

parameter.name: readonly
parameter.help: Indicates that the user cannot modify the content in the text-area

tag.name: tfoot
tag.help: Defines a table footer.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

tag.name: th
tag.help: Defines a table header cell in a table. The text within the th element usually renders in bold.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Specifies if this cell provides header information for the rest of the row that contains it

parameter.name: rowspan
parameter.help: Indicates the number of rows this cell should span

parameter.name: nowrap
parameter.help: Whether to disable or enable automatic text wrapping in this cell. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.help: A space-separated list of cell IDs that supply header information for the cell. This attribute allows text-only browsers to render the header information for a given cell

parameter.name: colspan
parameter.help: Indicates the number of columns this cell should span

parameter.name: abbr
parameter.help: Specifies an abbreviated version of the content in a cell

parameter.name: axis
parameter.help: Defines a name for a cell

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Specifies the background color of the table cell. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

tag.name: thead
tag.help: Defines a table header.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

tag.name: title
tag.help: This element defines the title of the document.

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: The class of the element

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: A unique id for the element

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: An inline style definition

tag.name: tr
tag.help: Defines a row in a table.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Specifies the background color of the table cell. Deprecated. Use styles instead.

parameter.name: char
parameter.help: Specifies which character to align text on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

parameter.name: charoff
parameter.help: Specifies the alignment offset to the first character to align on. Note: Only used if align="char"!

tag.name: small
tag.help: Renders as smaller text

tag.name: big
tag.help: Renders as bigger text

tag.name: b
tag.help: Renders as bold text

tag.name: i
tag.help: Renders as italic text

tag.name: tt
tag.help: Renders as teletype or mono spaced text

tag.name: u
tag.help: ** The u element was deprecated in HTML 4.01. ** This tag defines underlined text.

tag.name: ul
tag.help: The <ul> tag defines an unordered list.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the character encoding of the target URL

tag.name: a
tag.help:
The <a> tag defines an anchor element. An anchor can be used in two ways:
To create a link to another document by using the href attribute To create a bookmark inside a document, by using the name or id attribute

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help: Specifies the character encoding of the target URL

parameter.name: coords
parameter.help: Specifies the coordinates appropriate to the shape attribute to define a region of an image for image maps

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: The target URL of the link

parameter.name: hreflang
parameter.help: The target URL of the link

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Names an anchor. Use this attribute to create a bookmark in a document. In future versions of XHTML the name attribute will be replaced by the id attribute!!

parameter.name: rel
parameter.help: Specifies the relationship between the current document and the target URL

parameter.name: rev
parameter.help: Specifies the relationship between the target URL and the current document

parameter.name: shape
parameter.help: Defines the type of region to be defined for mapping in the current area tag. Used with the coords attribute.

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: Defines the type of region to be defined for mapping in the current area tag. Used with the coords attribute.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Specifies the MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) type of the target URL
